SEARCH
Module server
Package com.etiennecollin.tp2.server

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
com.etiennecollin.tp2.server.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
class ClientHandler extends Object implements Runnable
The ClientHandler class implements the Runnable interface and handles incoming client connections to the server.

It delegates the execution of received commands to appropriate event handlers. The class contains methods for registering a client to a course, sending available courses to the client, filtering courses by semester and disconnecting from the client.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      ClientHandler(Socket client) throws IOException
      Creates a new client handler for a specific client.
      Parameters:
      client - The client that is to be handled.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when getting the client streams.

  • Method Details

    • addEventHandler

      private void addEventHandler(EventHandler handler)
      Adds a new event handler to the server's list of handlers.
      Parameters:
      handler - The event handler to add.

    • handleEvents

      private void handleEvents(String cmd, String arg)
      Delegates the execution of a command to the appropriate event handler.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command to execute.
      arg - The argument to pass to the event handler.

    • handleRegistration

      private void handleRegistration() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      This method handles the registration process of a client to a course.

      It reads the RegistrationForm object from the objectInputStream, writes the registration information to a text file, and sends a confirmation message to the client.

      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the text file containing the courses or when dealing with the input/output streams.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the content of the ObjectInputStream is not a RegistrationForm object.

    • handleLoadCourses

      private void handleLoadCourses(String semester) throws IOException
      Reads a file containing course information, filters the courses by semester if needed, and writes the filtered courses to an object output stream.
      Parameters:
      semester - A string representing the semester to filter the courses by.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the text file containing the courses or when writing to the output stream.

    • disconnect

      private void disconnect() throws IOException
      Sends a disconnection confirmation to the client, then closes the input/output streams and the client socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while closing the object input/output streams or the socket.

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs a continuous loop that listens to the client's command until the client disconnects.

      It catches any IO exceptions or class not found exceptions that may occur while listening to the client's command and handles the case where the client crashes without disconnecting by properly terminating the connection to the crashed client.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • listen

      private void listen() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Reads a command from the client through the object input stream and alerts the registered event handlers to handle the received command.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the input stream.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class of the serialized object in the input stream cannot be found.

    • processCommandLine

      private javafx.util.Pair<String,String> processCommandLine(String line)
      Processes a given command line into a pair of command and argument strings.
      Parameters:
      line - The command line to process.
      Returns:
      A pair containing the command and its arguments.

    • alertHandlers

      private void alertHandlers(String cmd, String arg)
      Alerts the registered event handlers to handle a given command and argument.
      Parameters:
      cmd - The command to handle.
      arg - The argument of the command to handle.
